thread.title: Catalogic CEO and Catalogic Customer to Speak at NetApp Insight(TM) 2015
thread.title_full: Catalogic CEO and Catalogic Customer to Speak at NetApp Insight(TM) 2015

author: admin
title: Catalogic CEO and Catalogic Customer to Speak at NetApp Insight(TM) 2015
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/2/2015 @ 8:16 AM   Catalogic Software 
WOODCLIFF LAKE, NJ -- (Marketwired) -- 10/02/15 -- Catalogic Software , the leading provider of software-defined copy data management solutions, today announced that its CEO, Ed Walsh, will be speak at NetApp Insight , NetApp's major annual convention taking place October 12-15th in Las Vegas. Walsh's session, entitled "Power Your Data Fabric with Data Orchestration and Automation," will demonstrate the impact that Catalogic's software-only copy data management platform can have across a company's IT infrastructure, including both private and public clouds. Catalogic customer Stepphon Gayle of Fairfax County (VA) Public Schools will join Walsh to provide session attendees with a customer view of the benefits of Catalogic's ECX solution in his NetApp storage environment. The session is #3442-2 and will be held on Wednesday, October 14th at 10:30 AM. Conference attendees may view details and pre-register for this session within the Insight online Event Catalog. 
The Catalogic session will demonstrate how mission-critical functions that run within a "Data Fabric" -- a term that refers to the interconnected collection of a company's IT environments inclusive of the cloud -- share a common need for access to copies of production data. Real world examples will be used to show the importance of a robust software-defined copy data management platform within a global Data Fabric. The session will include a live demonstration of Catalogic's flagship copy data management platform, ECX, showing how the platform leverages the NetApp ONTAP solutions that are already deployed in a customer environment, preserving the customer investment and delivering superior ROI. 
"I'm honored to present again this year at NetApp's Insight conference," said Walsh. "Since last year, we've launched several new versions of ECX, been recognized with several industry awards, and have rapidly grown our installations within the NetApp customer base. This year, we look forward to demonstrating cutting edge functionality that is ideal for NetApp enterprise customers, and discussing real world results with NetApp's customers and channel partners." 
Stepphon Gayle commented, "My team supports the IT infrastructure for 35,000 teachers and over 200,000 students, and we rely on both NetApp and Catalogic to get the job done. I'm looking forward to joining Ed on stage at Insight, and sharing my experiences using Catalogic's ECX to enable several key functions that my team is responsible for." 
In addition to Mr. Walsh's session, Catalogic's Technical Manager of Global Alliances, Prashant Jagannathan, has been invited to address NetApp Insight in the NetApp Pavilion for two sessions: Tuesday, October 13 at 12:45 PM and Wednesday, October 14 at 12:15 PM. Mr. Jagannathan will present the results of a recent technical validation conducted with NetApp and IBM Softlayer, demonstrating the use of ECX to automate DR functionality in a hybrid cloud environment. This validation is documented in NetApp's Technical Report, "Copy Data Management for a Hybrid Cloud," available online in the NetApp library ( TR-4447 ). 
NetApp Insight is NetApp's annual technical conference for storage and data management professionals. It gives customers, engineers, consultants and partners a forum for learning from industry experts and each other. Attendees can chose from more than 300 technical sessions, participate in self-paced Hands-On Labs, and earn NetApp Certifications. 
About Catalogic Software Catalogic Software is the market's leading software provider of intelligent Copy Data solutions. Founded in 1996 and with thousands of customers worldwide, Catalogic's mission is to enable IT organizations to leverage their copy data, delivering significant reductions to CAPEX and OPEX while providing superior services to the business. With its software products, Catalogic helps clients Manage, Orchestrate and Analyze their Copy Data across their enterprise and cloud in support of mission critical IT functions including disaster recovery, test/dev, DevOps, next generation data protection, and business analytics. Learn more at www.catalogicsoftware.com Contact:
